results.feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly describes and demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests transaction CSVs, analyzes spending, produces budgets, recommendations, and a 90-day plan (Implement evidence) driven by a stated goal to create a finance advisor (Discover). The depth and concrete outputs shown justify a PASS under the moderate DRIVER-aligned standard.
- Integrate AI: The submission clearly describes AI as the core "brain" that ingests CSV data, categorizes transactions, computes a financial health score, produces visualizations, and generates personalized 90-day plans and behavioral recommendations. Implementation evidence (Google AI Studio, prompt engineering, Gemini API) and the detailed description of AI-driven outputs show effective, substantive integration beyond a superficial use, satisfying PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I decided to do build a financial health advisor that analyzes your current spending habits and then advises you on your next steps in terms of better budgeting better spending habits"

"I thought about it in terms of the driver framework where I was like okay I want to obviously have a financial health advisor tool that will take in input of your current state of finances and output you basically, I guess, an improved budget or a better finance plan"

"uploading your spending data that you have will analyze your behavioral patterns, protect the credit score, as well as give you a 90-day transformation plan to improve your spending and financial habits."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: Articulated goal to build an intelligent finance tool (financial health advisor).  
- Implement: Described building and demonstrating the app (CSV upload, processing, outputs like health score, budgets, graphs) in Google AI Studio.  
- Reflect: Reflected on effectiveness and tooling (Gemini API) confirming functioning implementation.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly describes and demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests transaction CSVs, analyzes spending, produces budgets, recommendations, and a 90-day plan (Implement evidence) driven by a stated goal to create a finance advisor (Discover). The depth and concrete outputs shown justify a PASS under the moderate DRIVER-aligned standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So it's the compassionate financial diagnosis, where just uploading your spending data that you have will analyze your behavioral patterns, protect the credit score, as well as give you a 90-day transformation plan to improve your spending and financial habits."
"in Google AI Studio I just very simply used a little bit of prompt engineering..."
"the Gemini API has been very strong, very helpful to make this happen and build it out"
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly describes AI as the core "brain" that ingests CSV data, categorizes transactions, computes a financial health score, produces visualizations, and generates personalized 90-day plans and behavioral recommendations. Implementation evidence (Google AI Studio, prompt engineering, Gemini API) and the detailed description of AI-driven outputs show effective, substantive integration beyond a superficial use, satisfying PASS.

results.feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission shows a working financial application through multiple concrete features and demonstrations: asset-level analysis (ticker input and thesis), portfolio analytics (composition/diversification), and scenario stress-testing with projected impacts. IMPLEMENT evidence of iterative builds plus DISCOVER/REFLECT context confirm comprehensive, functioning financial app rather than a vague concept.
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration across multiple, functional components (asset analysis, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) with examples (Tesla analysis, diversification score, stress-test) and uses APIs, memory state, and iterative prompt engineering—showing the AI adds substantive value. The student's IMPLEMENT and REFLECT stages confirm thoughtful design and handling of limitations, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So it's a instant AI powered reality check for any public asset. You can type in any uh timber sickle or ticker symbol or asset name."
"But how I went about this was first I did the asset analyzer, then for version two to upgrade it, I did the portfolio snapshot, and then for version three, I added the scenario lab."
"So, when we run this stress stress test, tells us our information up here and our projected impact and how it might in affect our portfolio."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- DISCOVER: Defined the task and target users ("build an investment analysis model... used by retail investors") establishing the financial-app goal.
- IMPLEMENT: Demonstrated development and iteration (asset analyzer, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) and live examples (Tesla analysis, portfolio inputs, stress test) showing the app performs financial functions.
- REFLECT: Discussed trust, disclaimers, and ethical considerations, supporting the app's practical financial use and responsible deployment.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working financial application through multiple concrete features and demonstrations: asset-level analysis (ticker input and thesis), portfolio analytics (composition/diversification), and scenario stress-testing with projected impacts. IMPLEMENT evidence of iterative builds plus DISCOVER/REFLECT context confirm comprehensive, functioning financial app rather than a vague concept.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So this model will roughly include a way to analyze assets, also a way to rate your portfolio and see any hidden risk involved and then also perform a scenario lab to test the portfolio durability during certain economic events."

"But before I dive into what it does, this is the prompt that I went about. ... So then after it put out that, I added some additional instructions to better um, better make this. And a lot of it was just me going back and forth with the AI um trying to figure out um how to best build it and make it clear enough for the user to understand."
"It mainly includes external data integration via APIs uh memory state that can influence recommendations as shown here and then also multiple sanity checks and disclaimers."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: defined the AI-driven goal and user need (asset analysis, portfolio rating, scenario lab).
- Implement: described prompt engineering, iterative back-and-forth with the model, versioned features (asset analyzer, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab), and API/data integration.
- Reflect: evaluated user impact, prompt-engineering challenges, and ethical/disclaimer considerations supporting effective AI use.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration across multiple, functional components (asset analysis, portfolio snapshot, scenario lab) with examples (Tesla analysis, diversification score, stress-test) and uses APIs, memory state, and iterative prompt engineering—showing the AI adds substantive value. The student's IMPLEMENT and REFLECT stages confirm thoughtful design and handling of limitations, meeting the PASS standard.

results.feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly defined and implemented a working financial tool (an SWR calculator) and demonstrated its functionality with multiple simulations and concrete outputs (portfolio trajectories, withdrawals, survival rates). The DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Validate/Reflect) provide direct evidence that the app performs financial tasks, meeting the PASS standard for thoroughness.
- Integrate AI: The student shows concrete, repeated use of AI (Gemini + Google AI Studio) to design, implement, and validate the SWR tool, including AI-generated prompts, scenario inputs, and human-readable explanations of year-by-year actions. They also reflect on limitations and prompt engineering, indicating substantive integration rather than superficial use.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I decided to make a safe withdrawal safe withdrawal rate calculator or SWR ... which is used to tell a retiree or a person who's recently retired how much they can spend in a certain year"
"I developed the app using Google AI Studio."

"it shows us a portfolio trajectory, how much we'll have left per year ... it shows the outcome of survival as in how much you'll have positive funds in your account ... how much they'll withdraw over the 30 years ... and then the final balance"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (defined the SWR decision and goals), Implement (built the app in Google AI Studio and used Gemini to generate prompts), Validate/Reflect (ran multiple market scenarios and reviewed simulation outputs and ledger actions).
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly defined and implemented a working financial tool (an SWR calculator) and demonstrated its functionality with multiple simulations and concrete outputs (portfolio trajectories, withdrawals, survival rates). The DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Validate/Reflect) provide direct evidence that the app performs financial tasks, meeting the PASS standard for thoroughness.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I developed the app using Google AI Studio."
"I use Google Gemini to help come up with the idea and using that information generate a prompt to input it into Google AI Studio."

"this ledger details part was part of my second loop where I wanted to help it to explain better, you know, how to um yeah, explain in words the actions to take um and how that would affect our withdrawal amount in our portfolio."
criteria.driver_alignment: Implemented (developed the app in Google AI Studio), Represent (used AI/Gemini to decide what calculations and outputs to include), Validate (Gemini generated test inputs and scenarios), Reflect (noted prompt-engineering challenges and need for further loops).
criteria.reasoning: The student shows concrete, repeated use of AI (Gemini + Google AI Studio) to design, implement, and validate the SWR tool, including AI-generated prompts, scenario inputs, and human-readable explanations of year-by-year actions. They also reflect on limitations and prompt engineering, indicating substantive integration rather than superficial use.

results.feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application: it ingests savings/goal/timeframe, performs gap analysis and monthly contribution math, produces portfolio allocations and expected returns, and emails a personalized investment guide. Evidence from Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages shows both the tool's financial logic and verified outputs, meeting the thoroughness required for PASS.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates a working AI integration (uses OpenAI chat model and calculator) that produces specific, value-adding outputs (detailed allocations and rationale). Discover, Implement, and Reflect evidence shows the AI component is central, functional, and validated, meeting the criterion for effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "This is my code. This is my AI tool that I built. Um, it has the chat message received, which I type in the configuration, the investment parameters, and then our generator right here uses our OpenAI chat model and a calculator to calculate the investments"

"I currently have $12,000 and I want to buy a car that costs $18,000 and I want to buy this car within four years... I just got received this email. There's my personalized investment guide created by my AI tool."
"it only took about 15 seconds for it to calculate my goal and my uh plan of action that it recommends me to take."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: student defines financial decision problem and goals (savings, target, timeframe). Implement: student describes code, generator, calculator, allocations and expected returns. Reflect: student verifies output (emailed investment guide), comments on accuracy, speed, and usefulness.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application: it ingests savings/goal/timeframe, performs gap analysis and monthly contribution math, produces portfolio allocations and expected returns, and emails a personalized investment guide. Evidence from Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages shows both the tool's financial logic and verified outputs, meeting the thoroughness required for PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "our generator right here uses our OpenAI chat model and a calculator to calculate the investments"
"for our mini project 3, we had to build an AI tool that can help us ... analyze or explain something on a financial decision"
"first is Vanguard VTI ... They want me to place 40% of my uh what is it? $12,000 into this and a projected return uh annually of 7%."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: identified a concrete user need (personalized investment planning).  
Implement: built a generator that uses the OpenAI chat model + calculator and sends personalized email outputs.  
Reflect: verified usefulness and speed (tool produces actionable recommendations quickly).
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working AI integration (uses OpenAI chat model and calculator) that produces specific, value-adding outputs (detailed allocations and rationale). Discover, Implement, and Reflect evidence shows the AI component is central, functional, and validated, meeting the criterion for effective AI integration.

results.feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission shows a functioning financial application through multiple concrete examples (real-time crypto pricing and news, GDP analysis with charts, trending stocks grouped by sector) and an implemented query/analysis flow. While the student notes stability issues, the tool nonetheless performs core financial tasks and provides analysis and sources, meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows multiple, concrete AI integrations (API-driven price/news retrieval, multi-step reasoning, charts, sector grouping) and discusses guardrails and limitations, meeting the requirement for effective AI integration. The student also reflects on utility and reliability, supporting a thorough, applied integration rather than a superficial mention.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "retrieve the top ten trending stocks and group them by sector. Which sectors are the most active today?"
"we're gonna understand the context, explain the concepts, provide personalized insight, and explain why, not just what."
"So that's basically my financial tool here, um. You just ask a question and it'll give you, you know, the rundown and break it down a little bit for you here."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student frames the problem and goals ("understand the context...provide personalized insight"), showing intent to build a financial app.  
Implement: multiple executed examples (Bitcoin price & news, GDP comparison, trending stocks by sector, charts) demonstrate the tool performing financial tasks.  
Reflect: student comments on usefulness and limitations ("having AI to do it in a split second is very, very helpful" and notes crashes), showing evaluation of the application's behavior.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a functioning financial application through multiple concrete examples (real-time crypto pricing and news, GDP analysis with charts, trending stocks grouped by sector) and an implemented query/analysis flow. While the student notes stability issues, the tool nonetheless performs core financial tasks and provides analysis and sources, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "and basically I, I went with uh. You know this external data via API calls, price rates, news and incorporate into analysis as well as structured or excuse me, as well as a multi step reasoning tool."
"we're gonna understand the context, explain the concepts, provide personalized insight, and explain why, not just what."
"having AI to do it in a split second is very, very helpful."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student frames the problem and goals (quote 2) guiding AI design.  
Implement: student shows concrete AI features and use cases (external APIs, multi-step reasoning, charts, live queries) demonstrating execution.  
Reflect: student notes benefits and limitations (quote 3), indicating evaluation of the AI integration.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows multiple, concrete AI integrations (API-driven price/news retrieval, multi-step reasoning, charts, sector grouping) and discusses guardrails and limitations, meeting the requirement for effective AI integration. The student also reflects on utility and reliability, supporting a thorough, applied integration rather than a superficial mention.
